intro: Maba cupulosa, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. The botanical features of Maba cupulosa make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
